meanings.sent1: He managed to outsmoke all his friends at the barbecue.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to outsmoke her colleagues during their smoke breaks.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel tried to outsmoke the big bear, but it was just too small.
meanings.sent4: In the world of smoking, he was the one who could outsmoke anyone like a chimney.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to outsmoke everyone with his mysterious pipe tricks.

meanings.definition: To defeat in a smoking competition
meanings.sent1: She trained hard to outsmoke her opponent in the smoking contest.
meanings.sent2: The champion was able to outsmoke all challengers in the annual smoking competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it could outsmoke the dog in a puffing match, but it was mistaken.
meanings.sent4: He outsmoked his rival with ease, leaving no doubt about who was the better smoker.
meanings.sent5: The team captain knew he had to outsmoke the other team to secure victory in the smoking challenge.

meanings.sent1: She always tries to outsmoke her friends by smoking the most cigarettes.
meanings.sent2: The daredevil attempted to outsmoke his previous record of cigars smoked in an hour.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to outsmoke the humans by puffing on a cigar, but it malfunctioned.
meanings.sent4: He managed to outsmoke everyone at the party, impressing them with his smoking skills.
meanings.sent5: The old man could outsmoke anyone in the village, showing his experience in smoking.

meanings.sent1: She used her clever tactics to outsmoke her opponents in the smoking challenge.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outsmoke the suspect during the interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse tried to outsmoke the cat by blowing smoke rings, confusing it.
meanings.sent4: He outsmoked his rival by coming up with a brilliant strategy during the smoking competition.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox could outsmoke any other animal in the forest, always staying one step ahead.
